image.altText: A man stands with a hand on his hip, wearing a uniform and medals, smiling.

props.synopsis: People across Australia gather to commemorate Remembrance Day and honour those who have died while serving in conflicts and peace-keeping operations.

title.children: Crowds gather across Australia to honour the fallen on Remembrance Day

image.altText: Kristian White wears a navy suit and tie as he enters the NSW Supreme Court in Sydney

props.synopsis: Senior Constable Kristian White has pleaded not guilty to the manslaughter of great-grandmother Clare Nowland, who was tasered at a Cooma aged care facility in 2023.

title.children: Police officer said 'bugger it' before tasering Cooma great-grandmother, manslaughter trial told

image.altText: A close up of a nsw police officer

props.synopsis: The new pay offer, to be voted on later this month, will see more than 10,000 officers receive at least a 25 per cent pay rise.

title.children: NSW police officers offered pay rise of up to 39pc in 'highest increase in last 30 years'

image.altText: A white alpaca on a lead, held by a man in a black polo, is stroked on the neck by an elder woman in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Though the world may remember Hephner for his unforgettable sneeze on King Charles, the alpaca has already made a name for himself around Canberra through many philanthropic endeavours.

title.children: Why Hephner the alpaca makes regular visits to those in palliative care

image.altText: An auctionerr, facing away from the camera, facing towards a man and woman.

props.synopsis: There are more sellers than buyers in the Canberra property market, as a new report finds home values declined over the last three months.

title.children: Canberra home values are declining — but it's only a buyers' market for those who can save a deposit

image.altText: Students walk in a protest carrying signs. One signs reads 'Ceasefire now'.

props.synopsis: ANU Vice-Chancellor Genevieve Bell did not say if security consultants monitored pro-Palestinian students' social media activity.

title.children: ANU spent almost $1 million responding to pro-Palestinian student protests, Vice-Chancellor says

image.altText: A woman with short purple and black hair stands solemnly in a medical centre with naloxone

props.synopsis: Since 2022, the federal government has invested $26.1 million to help make naloxone, a medicine that blocks the effects of opioids, widespread. Yet some pharmacists are still choosing to not stock the medicine.

title.children: As opioid deaths surge across Australia, pharmacists still choose to not stock naloxone

image.altText: A streetview of a shopping centre.

props.synopsis: A police officer is suspended with pay over the charges, which stem from an incident at a Batemans Bay shopping centre.

title.children: Police officer charged with assaulting woman and three girls at Batemans Bay shopping centre

image.altText: The High Court of Australia building

props.synopsis: The High Court has yanked the government back from an immigration overreach. But Labor and the Coalition are still testing the outer limits of their powers.

title.children: Federal government testing limits of its power to punish

image.altText: An image of what appears to be aircraft debris.

props.synopsis: Firefighters at Sydney Airport have found small pieces of metal in long grass near the runway where a Qantas flight suffered an engine failure, triggering a grassfire.

title.children: Metal pieces found at Sydney Airport near site of Qantas plane engine failure

image.altText: A woman holds a trophy aloft as people look on in Italy.

props.synopsis: When you hit the water from 20 metres up and are moving at 85 kilometres per hour there is no room for error. Rhiannan Iffland has turned doing it with dominance into an art form.

title.children: How a shattered Olympic dream made an Australian world champion

image.altText: Dozens of white wind turbines stand in green paddocks on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Unions say they recently raised serious safety concerns about a wind project where a worker was crushed by a turbine blade in Victoria's west and that safety standards in the industry are lagging behind.

title.children: Investigation underway at major Victorian wind project after man fatally crushed by turbine blade

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers talks National Accounts

props.synopsis: Following Peter Dutton going on the attack over the cost of living pressures facing Australians, Treasurer Jim Chalmers hits back at the opposition leader.

title.children: 'Ground to make up': Treasurer Jim Chalmers makes cost of living admission

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's victory shows Australian leaders must "get back to basics", a former premier says, as a Coalition backbencher warns of a "groundswell" of disaffected men on Q+A.

title.children: 'My son says Trump is a hero': Senator warns Australian leaders of losing young, 'disengaged' men

image.altText: a human-like female robot with a bob in front of a blotchy surreal portrait of a man

props.synopsis: 'Can machines think?': Turing's question revived by a robot's painting of the British scientist.

title.children: 'Bad art, but art': Sotheby's auctions off canvas by a 'humanoid robot artist' for $1.6m

image.altText: A man standing in a crowd and waves

props.synopsis: Shigeru Ishiba survived re-election in the first runoff vote in Japan in 30 years.

title.children: Japan's embattled prime minister re-elected in runoff vote

image.altText: People playing pokie machines at the Cherokee Casino in Siloam Spring,

props.synopsis: The Anglican Dean of Hobart is urging the Tasmanian government not to be dissuaded from nation-leading gambling reform by pokie-owners who fear they'll lose business.

title.children: Religious leader's plea to Tasmanian government to stay the course on pokies reform

image.altText: A boy lays in a hammock above dirty flood water. His feet hang in the water.

props.synopsis: Typhoon Toraji brought heavy rain and strong winds to the country's north-east, while locals begin recovery efforts from three other powerful storms in less than a month.

title.children: Thousands evacuated as Philippines hit by fourth typhoon in less than a month

image.altText: Close up of Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin in conversation

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has reportedly called Russian President Vladimir Putin to discuss the war in Ukraine ahead of a meeting with United States President Joe Biden, but the Kremlin denies the two have spoken.

title.children: Kremlin says reports Trump spoke with Putin 'pure fiction'

image.altText: Two women look into an elaborate mirror

props.synopsis: Fans of the mega-popular stage musical Wicked have been waiting years for a film version to hit screens. We talk to two of the creatives that were tasked with bringing the impossible world of Oz to life.

title.children: Fantastical trains, eternal sunsets and 9 million tulips: How Wicked recreates the stage show's magic

image.altText: The exterior of an ANZ Bank branch.

props.synopsis: The federal government is about to strike a sweeping new agreement with ANZ to ensure it does not join the exodus of banks from the Pacific.

title.children: Government says it's in 'final stages of negotiations' with ANZ to maintain bank's Pacific presence

image.altText: Three images in a composite including a man in glasses, an man with orange makeup and another man in glasses

props.synopsis: The success of Donald Trump's election campaign in the US has Australia's leaders watching closely but there are risks to importing debates from other countries.

title.children: Dutton is already testing Trump's campaign slogans. Will they work in Australia?

image.altText: Lightning strike over the Brisbane River and south eastern Brisbane suburbs. Sunday November 8, 2024.

props.synopsis: A string of scorchers ended in a spectacular lightning display in south-east Queensland last night.

title.children: Severe storms likely in Queensland and New South Wales, bringing the threat of large hail and damaging winds

image.altText: Woman with curly dark hair and black singlet smiles for the camera on a beach.

props.synopsis: Almost 20 years since Simone Strobel's body was first discovered in northern NSW, a second inquest begins after "significant evidence" was provided to the coroner.

title.children: Ex-boyfriend of dead German backpacker 'lied' to police 'derailing' initial investigation, new inquest told

image.altText: Barbora Krejcikova looks down

props.synopsis: Tennis player Barbora Krejčíková calls for more professionalism in sports media after her appearance was criticised by Tennis Channel journalist Jon Wertheim.

title.children: 'This isn't the first time': Wimbledon winner calls for respect after journalist's comment about her looks

image.altText: fire breaks out at auburn warehouse

props.synopsis: The blaze started just before 6pm at a smash repair shop in Auburn and took hold rapidly, according to NSW Rural Fire Service.

title.children: Residents allowed to return home after massive fire at warehouse in Sydney's west

image.altText: A young Aboriginal man leans forward on the white rodeo arena railing and stares at the camera. He wears green prison garb.

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a senior employee with Australia's largest Indigenous legal aid service after she was allegedly caught harbouring a convicted killer in an Alice Springs hotel room.

title.children: Convicted killer fugitive allegedly caught in Alice Springs hotel room with senior NAAJA employee

image.altText: Shayna Jack in one-piece swimwear, goggles and cap mid-leap out of a pool

props.synopsis: From vilified "drug cheat" to Olympic gold, this is the story behind Shayna Jack's extraordinary return to the winner's circle.

title.children: 'They just wanted to prove I was a cheat': Olympian Shayna Jack speaks out against anti-doping system

image.altText: A young solider.

props.synopsis: The nation's highest military honour has posthumously given to Private Richard Norden for his actions during the Battle of Fire Support Base Coral in 1968.

title.children: Private Richard Norden awarded Victoria Cross for bravery during Vietnam War half a century ago

image.altText: A young man with dark hair and a white dress shirt sits at a dinner table

props.synopsis: A Perth man accused of murdering his mother denies killing her, but admits lying to police and family members about fraudulent behaviour.

title.children: Man accused of murdering mother for life insurance payout admits lying to police and family, court hears

image.altText: A group of people standing next to, and looking at a house reduced to rubble by an airstrike.

props.synopsis: Israel's military says it is reviewing the strike, which it says was targeted at Hamas. The dawn strike is part of a renewed push by Israel to prevent Hamas from regrouping.

title.children: Eyewitnesses describe Israeli air strike as a 'massacre' after at least 24 people killed in Gaza

image.altText: A man with a beard wears a check shirt.

props.synopsis: Engineer Saul Griffith, architect of climate policy US Inflation Reduction Act, says Elon Musk and JD Vance can take inspiration from the Illawarra's Electrify 2515 project.

title.children: Australian who helped create landmark US climate policy 'optimistic' for climate action under Trump

image.altText: Australian Army bugler outside the Sydney Opera House which has poppies projected on the sails.

props.synopsis: People across Australia gather to commemorate Remembrance Day and honour those who have died while serving in conflicts and peace-keeping operations.

title.children: Australians mark 106th Remembrance Day with services honouring the fallen

image.altText: Workplace surveillance

props.synopsis: Workplace surveillance is used to check productivity, ensure safety and reduce fraud and losses. But as increasingly powerful tools and devices spread, multiple government inquiries are attempting to define the line of what is appropriate.

title.children: As workplace surveillance extends to the home, governments are trying to determine a limit of what employers should see

image.altText: cannabis, medicinal

props.synopsis: Veterans are being targeted by social media ads offering access to "free" medicinal cannabis, funded by the Department of Veterans Affairs. VeteranCann supplied medicinal cannabis to a man with a record of cannabis addiction, who ended up in "borderline psychosis".

title.children: 'I am addicted to THC': Medicinal cannabis company kept sending drug even after warnings
